active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group debate, argue whether data protection clauses or incident response timelines are more critical in cybersecurity SLAs for third-party providers. Support your position with real-world examples like the SolarWinds supply chain breach, referencing NIST SP 800-161 guidelines and the impact on enterprise risk posture.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator specializing in cybersecurity education, aligned with university pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, scaffolding). Generate 50 high-quality flashcards on 'Service Level Agreement (SLA) Security Clauses' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Personnel Security > Third-Party and Contractor Personnel Security > Third-Party Security Requirements > SLA Security Clauses). Incorporate: - Research Context: SLAs define services/metrics/remedies; Cybersecurity SLAs cover scope (e.g., intrusion detection), SLOs (targets like uptime), KPIs (measurements), roles/responsibilities, data protection/compliance (e.g., encryption, regulations). Standards: NIST SP 800-161 (supply chain), ISO 27001, CMMC. Sources: NIST SP 800-53/161, ISO 27001, ITIL. - Learning Objectives: [insert full array from 'learning_objectives']. - Scaffolding Layers: [insert full descriptions from 'scaffolding']. Distribute cards: 30% Layer 1, 25% Layer 2, 25% Layer 3, 20% Layer 4; span Bloom's evenly. - Active Learning Ties: Weave in discussion/peer/problem-solving elements (e.g., cards prompting debate on clauses or drafting scenarios). - Prior Knowledge: Link to contract law, IT SLAs, third-party risks. Use Flashcard Schema: - Structure: JSON array of objects: {'id':1, 'bloom_level':'REMEMBER', 'layer':1, 'type':'qa' or 'mc', 'front':'...', 'back':'...', 'explanation':'...', 'tags':['SLA', 'NIST']} - Q&A: Front=Question (e.g., 'Define SLA in cybersecurity'), Back=Answer. - MC: Front=Stem+'A)opt1 B)opt2 C)opt3 D)opt4', Back='Correct: C) ...'. - Distractors: Plausible per protocol. - Explanations: Detailed per requirements. Best Practices: Active recall (no cues in front), spaced repetition (concise), varied difficulty, 10% CREATE-level (e.g., 'Draft a clause for...'). Output ONLY valid JSON array.
